notes.text:
Don't overwork the meat mixture
Browning adds flavor to the sauce
Add a pinch of sugar to balance acidity

steps.descr: Mix beef, egg, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and garlic

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by mixing the beef, egg, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and garlic together. Make sure it's all nicely combined, but don't overwork it!

steps.instructions: Mix beef, egg, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and garlic

on_enter.say: Now, let's roll these into lovely golf ball-sized meatballs. Try to keep them even so they cook perfectly.

steps.descr: Brown meatballs in a pan on all sides

on_enter.say: Let's get these meatballs sizzling in a hot pan. We want them browned on all sides for that beautiful flavour.

steps.instructions: Brown meatballs in a pan on all sides

steps.descr: Add tinned tomatoes and basil to pan

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now add those tinned tomatoes and a handful of fresh basil to the pan. This is where the magic happens!

steps.instructions: Add tinned tomatoes and basil to pan

on_enter.say: Let's let this simmer gently for 25 to 30 minutes. You'll know it's ready when the sauce is rich and the meatballs are tender.
While that's simmering away, let's get the spaghetti cooking. Follow the package instructions and cook it to perfection.

steps.descr: Serve meatballs and sauce over pasta

on_enter.say: Time to plate up! Serve those gorgeous meatballs and rich sauce over your perfectly cooked spaghetti. Enjoy your meal!

steps.instructions: Serve meatballs and sauce over pasta

recipe.title: Meatballs in Marinara
recipe.description: Tender Italian meatballs in rich tomato sauce
